name: Osmar R. Zaïane
content: Professor Osmar Zaiane Web Page I am a Professor and Researcher in the Department of Computing Science at the University of Alberta. I specialize in Data Mining and Machine Learning. To learn about my research interests you can visit my Research page or my Publication List. In a nutshell, my research is about the discovery of patterns and regularities in large complex data, patterns that can become actionable in real applications. Therefore, I am particularly interested in applied Machine Learning but also Outlier detection,, Clustering, Contrast sets and other patterns. Notably, I am working on Social Network Analysis, the analysis of large graphs of nodes and relationships, to discover meaningful structures, we call communities. I have many projects related to precision health, but also in many other domains. For teaching and administration roles I have, you can visit the respective pages in the menu above. For media and organizers, a bibliographical Sketch (short and long) is available HERE with publically usable photos. Office:4-43 Athabasca HallEdmonton, AlbertaT6G 2E8, Canada Tel: +1 (780) 492 2860Fax: +1 (780) 492 1071 Search my site Appointments -- Travel Since July 8, 1999, you are visitor [ ] to Osmar Zaïane's home page. My legacy web page is still accessible here. This page and the local pages linked within, their contents and style, are the responsibility of the author and do not necessarily represent the views, policies or opinions of the University of Alberta.
